meanings.definition: The movement or growth of an organism in response to temperature changes.
meanings.sent1: The thermotropism of the plant caused it to bend towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study thermotropism to understand how plants adapt to different climates.
meanings.sent3: The thermotropism of the lizard made it seek out a warm rock to bask on.
meanings.sent4: The thermotropism of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful display of colors.
meanings.sent5: The thermotropism of the tree roots helped them find the optimal temperature for growth.

meanings.definition: The orientation of an organism in response to temperature gradients.
meanings.sent1: The thermotropism of the fish allowed it to swim to cooler waters during the heatwave.
meanings.sent2: Birds exhibit thermotropism by positioning themselves to catch the warm sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The thermotropism of the cat led it to curl up next to the fireplace on cold nights.
meanings.sent4: The thermotropism of the ants guided them to the warmest part of the garden for their nest.
meanings.sent5: The thermotropism of the bees helps them regulate the temperature inside the hive.
